comments:
I've been corresponding with Beth on this. My latest attempt:
1. Download Eclipse Europa for C++
2. Extract pldt into eclipse install dir
3. Start Eclipse and setup new workspace
4. Import MPITest project from previous workspace
5. Set PLDT preferences to point to my include dir
6. Run MPI Artifact analysis.
7. I get a "Analysis completed with errors" dialog.
8. Heres the output on the console:
==>Error running analysis: ITE null  cause: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.eclipse.cdt.core.dom.ast.IASTTranslatio

It looks like you've got CDT 4.0 and PLDT 1.1, which is a mismatch.
PLDT 1.1 needs Eclipse 3.2 and CDT 3.1
PLDT 2.0 needs Eclipse 3.3 and CDT 4.0 (Europa)

Hmmm... if we got the update site working again, this wouldn't happen
(because it would recognize the pre-reqs).

I think in your previous correspondence you had matching versions, 
so please try again and tell me what happens.

Created an attachment (id=75354)
pldt with tracing

PLDT 2.0.0 8/3/07 with tracing enabled.

OK I have attached a new version of PLDT with tracing enabled.

Here is what i think you need to do 
Create a file ".options" in the same directory as your eclipse executable

Put this in the file:
org.eclipse.ptp.pldt.common/debug = true
org.eclipse.ptp.pldt.common/debug/pldtTrace = true

Then launch eclipse in debug mode using the -debug option, and mirror the Console view output
to the command line console using the -consoleLog option.  (Maybe Linux already spits out the console, not sure.)
When you run with this tracing enabled,  I should be spitting out a bunch of trace information as you run mpi analysis.

Try it on a very small MPI c file and attach the trace output to the bug.

P.S. that version of PLDT I think should also test that CDT is at least
at version 4.0 so try with your mismatched pldt 2.0 with CDT 3.1 and see if it complains!

Yes I tested it: if you attempt to run PLDT 2.0 with a CDT other than 4.x,
it will complain.

It works now! But there was not trace output even with the .options file created and the -debug and -consoleLog options. Just to be sure I removed the install and tried again w/ the old pldt-2.0 plugin. That still doesn't work.

Let me know if there's any other info I can give you.
